intro: Heliotropium suaveolens subsp. bocconei, commonly known as the sweet scented heliotrope, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically pink or purple, which bloom in clusters. It is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. The subspecies is distinguished by its unique floral structure and aromatic properties.
